title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:09 <[1]jer> has quit  
01:06 <[1]jer> has joined #xwiki  
01:11 <[1]jer> has quit  
01:17 <jvelociter1> has quit  
01:29 <Ruudjah2> has quit  
03:01 <DrLou> has quit  
06:26 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:49 <sdumitriu> has quit  
06:59 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <tekzilla> has quit  
07:47 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi  
08:03 <@sdumitriu> Hi vmassol  
08:03 <vmassol> thomas has created a SCM macro for us to use so that we don't have to change again the urls in the future when we change scm  
08:04 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I know  
08:04 <@sdumitriu> I've been using it a lot  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> Hm, actually I thought it can't be used in the source property of an extension  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> Can it?  
08:05 <vmassol> ah  
08:05 <vmassol> I have no clue about that  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> Let's try  
08:05 <vmassol> you're probably right  
08:06 <vmassol> so you've been fixing broken links? cool :)  
08:06 <vmassol> (haven't read my mails yet)  
08:06 <@sdumitriu> Nope, broken  
08:07 <vmassol> we could make it work though if we wanted, depends if we want it  
08:15 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I've done almost all svn links  
08:15 <vmassol> sdumitriu: great, thanks  
08:15 <@sdumitriu> There should be some left in a few old comments and design archives  
08:18 <@sdumitriu> Would be great if you can regenerate the list  
08:18 <vmassol> yep will do  
08:18 <vmassol> done  
08:23 <vmassol> has quit  
09:04 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
09:06 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <+sburjan> good morning  
09:43 <jvelociter> has quit  
10:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <+sburjan> good morning vmassol  
10:16 <vmassol> sburjan: good morning  
10:16 <+sburjan> I have committed some minor modifications, because the code you committed yesterday wasn't the latest version. The only issue is that it still doesn't build locally  
10:16 <vmassol> yep seen it  
10:16 <vmassol> ah ok testing now  
10:17 <vmassol> sburjan: builds fine here  
10:17 <+sburjan> do I need mvn 3 ?  
10:17 <vmassol> maybe in any case we don't support mvn2  
10:18 <+sburjan> I am building with mvn clean package  
10:18 <vmassol> see the Building page  
10:18 <vmassol> what error do you get?  
10:18 <+sburjan> [INFO] [enforcer:enforce {execution: enforce-plugins}]  
10:18 <+sburjan> [WARNING] Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.RequirePluginVersions failed with message:  
10:18 <+sburjan> Some plugins are missing valid versions:(SNAPSHOT are not allowed )  
10:18 <+sburjan> org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-tool-xar-plugin. The version currently in use is 3.3-milestone-1  
10:19 <vmassol> try with mvn3 first  
10:20 <+sburjan> okay.  
10:20 <+sburjan> I knoew we only needed mvn3 for building platform and XE, not for small macros  
10:20 <vmassol> its the same  
10:20 <vmassol> since you have used the common pom as parent  
10:27 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <+sburjan> vmassol: worked with mvn3 :)  
10:28 <vmassol> cool  
10:28 <+sburjan> now removing mvn2 from package manager :)  
10:29 <sburjan> has quit  
10:30 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <+sburjan> ok, maven 2 completely removed, all paths and exported variables work fine with mvn3 :) I am going to import the xar to make a final test  
10:50 <+sburjan> vmassol: why is it 1.0-SNAPSHOT instead of 1.0 ?  
10:51 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <jomo\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <jomo> has quit  
10:58 <jomo\_> is now known as <jomo>  
11:01 <vmassol> sburjan: because 1.0-SNAPSHOT means the development that will lead to 1.0  
11:01 <vmassol> 1.0 means it's the final 1.0 version  
11:01 <vmassol> imagine you build your project and make it avail somewhere  
11:01 <vmassol> then you make a change and rebuild it again  
11:01 <vmassol> and make it avail  
11:02 <vmassol> you'll have 2 versions named 1.0 in the wold  
11:02 <vmassol> wild  
11:02 <+sburjan> ok, I understand  
11:02 <vmassol> but representing different things  
11:02 <+sburjan> so we'll make it 1.0 only when it's considered stable ?

11:07 <CIA-102> \* Improve the JavaScript code. - http://git.io/Lu35fA

11:39 <jomo> has quit  
11:47 <sburjan> I see an odd thing. If I import a xar into my wiki, AS will see it as created using the date from the XAR instead of that in which the import happend. This is a little bit confusing  
11:50 <sburjan> this should be fixed IMO  
11:51 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <evalica> sburjan: related to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7058 ?  
11:54 <sburjan> evalica: well I am not talking about the default XAR here. But I think that they are related because the date from the XML/XAR is used. For example, a use case would be the next: I go to extensions.xwiki.org, download a XAR which is 3 months old, import it. That will not apprea in my AS because it's too old  
11:56 <evalica> I pointed you the jira :) in order to sustain the cause :P  
11:58 <sburjan> I also get this when startint 3.3 M1  
11:58 <sburjan> \*starting  
11:58 <sburjan> 2011-11-02 12:58:01,878 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome] WARN  o.i.m.DefaultCacheManager      - ISPN000156: You are not starting all your caches at the same time. This can lead to problems as asymmetric clusters are not supported, see ISPN-658. We recommend using EmbeddedCacheManager.startCaches() to start all your caches upfront.

14:47 <+sburjan> vmassol: do you have time for the release of macro-jira ?  
14:52 <vmassol> sburjan: I'm entering a meeting but after yes  
14:52 <vmassol> (so in about 1 hour-  
14:52 <vmassol> )  
14:52 <+sburjan> hexcelent  
14:54 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* rb071a11 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XCOMMONS-56: Upgrade to Maven Checkstyle Plugin v2.8 - http://git.io/J7RKyQ

14:54 <CIA-102> XCOMMONS-56: Upgrade to Maven Checkstyle Plugin v2.8  
14:54 <CIA-102> \* Added more explanations - http://git.io/ZBFFGA  
15:04 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r03dc081 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-53: Upgrade to SLF4J 1.6.4 and Logback 1.0 - http://git.io/VNKP6w  
15:27 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* rec5027b / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-core/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/event/AbstractAnnotationEvent.java : Fixed code style error - http://git.io/Tl1mtQ  
15:28 <vmassol> sburjan: the meeting is starting late (hasn't started yet). I can release version 1.0 of the jira macro now if you wish  
15:29 <+sburjan> vmassol: no, I want to be present, I want to know thesteps. we can do it tomorrow, because in 1h I also have something to do  
15:29 <+sburjan> so let's leave it for tomorrow  
15:29 <vmassol> I don't know how to do it from your pov  
15:30 <jvelociter> has quit  
15:30 <vmassol> I'd need to spend time to check hwo staging is set up for xwiki-contrib  
15:30 <vmassol> I'll just release 1.0 and we can check later on how to set up staging for xwiki contrib  
15:30 <vmassol> s/set up/use/  
15:31 <vmassol> fyi what I'm runnning now is=  
15:31 <vmassol> mvn release:prepare  
15:31 <vmassol> and then  
15:31 <vmassol> mvn release:perform  
15:31 <vmassol> and that's all  
15:31 <+sburjan> where are you running this from ? our CI ?  
15:31 <vmassol> my local machine  
15:32 <vmassol> done  
15:32 <+sburjan> ok, I don't quite understand what is happening. :) so you release on your machine and it is automatically uploaded to extensions repo ?  
15:32 <vmassol> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/contrib/macro-jira/  
15:32 <vmassol> no  
15:32 <vmassol> maven remote repo  
15:32 <vmassol> see the link I pasted  
15:32 <+sburjan> ok  
15:32 <vmassol> now please contribute an extension on extension.xwiki.org  
15:37 <sdumitriu> sburjan: So XWiki works with IE9 now?  
15:38 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: It works, but I'm not done testing it.  
15:38 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: also, we got a reply from someone asking if we have tested this release with Oracle  
15:39 <vmassol> sburjan: ping me when you're done adding the extension on extension.xwiki.org (I'll see it here though ;))  
15:39 <+sburjan> vmassol: I think I won't have time to do it today, I will do it tomorrow morning. I have to finish testing  
15:42 <+sburjan> vmassol: doing it now. the fields I don't know how to fill I will leave blank  
15:42 <vmassol> ok  
15:42 <vmassol> or just ask here  
15:44 <sdumitriu> vmassol: One problem with the broken link reporting is that it also shows links from the history  
15:44 <sdumitriu> So even if we fix documents, their broken links will pop up from the older versions  
15:44 <vmassol> it shows all links that can be displayed to the user  
15:45 <vmassol> yep indeed  
15:45 <vmassol> but the link checker is correct :)  
15:46 <vmassol> when viewing a past revision containing a broken link it reports it  
15:46 <vmassol> it's the livetable UI which could filter things out  
15:46 <+sburjan> vmassol: I don't know the difference between id, name, title fields  
15:46 <vmassol> for ex ATM I'm filtering out ExternalLinkStatus itself ;)  
15:46 <vmassol> sburjan: me neither  
15:46 <vmassol> thomas messed it up  
15:46 <vmassol> use the same value for all ATM  
15:47 <+sburjan> okay  
15:47 <vmassol> I think it's because he hasn't finished  
15:47 <vmassol> and he's displaying the old app fields + the new XR fields  
15:47 <vmassol> I have pinged him 2 days ago about this but he hasn't answered yet  
15:47 <vmassol> and I don't know why he's not online today  
15:48 <vmassol> he's on holidays actually :)  
15:48 <vmassol> (that explains it)  
15:49 <vmassol> sburjan: let me know when you're done with the extension doc  
15:50 <vmassol> btw I think this macro will work with XE 3.2 too  
15:50 <+sburjan> I am looking to add the download link now  
15:50 <vmassol> (and possibly with earlier versions too)  
15:50 <+sburjan> ok, I modified to 3.2  
15:55 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am done. I still have to write some documentation like documenting all the params, screenshots, etc
